block.p: Arlene Rachel Rothman, a daughter of Tovah and Robert P. Rothman of Fayetteville, N.Y., was married last night to Adam Jacob Cohen, the son of Carol and Victor A. Cohen of Stamford, Conn. Rabbi Sheldon Ezring performed the ceremony at the Temple Society of Concord in Syracuse.
The bride, a cum laude graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, and the bridegroom, who graduated cum laude from Vassar College, received law degrees from Cornell.

Arlene Rachel Rothman, a daughter of Tovah and Robert P. Rothman of Fayetteville, N.Y., was married last night to Adam Jacob Cohen, the son of Carol and Victor A. Cohen of Stamford, Conn. Rabbi Sheldon Ezring performed the ceremony at the Temple Society of Concord in Syracuse.
The bride, a cum laude graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, and the bridegroom, who graduated cum laude from Vassar College, received law degrees from Cornell.

Mrs. Cohen, 25, is known as Rachel. Next month she is to become an associate at Pepe & Hazard, a Hartford law firm. Her father is the principal in a law practice bearing his name in Syracuse. Her mother is a teacher specializing in adolescents with learning disabilities at Fayetteville-Manlius High School.

Mr. Cohen, 27, is an associate specializing in civil rights and employment law at Pullman & Comley, a law firm in Bridgeport, Conn. His mother, who is retired, was a mortgage banker in White Plains for the Chase Manhattan Bank. His father is an associate general counsel working in Somers, N.Y., for I.B.M.
